name: Web Almanac Library
description:
About the Web Almanac

The Web Almanac is HTTP Archive's annual state of the web report. It’s located at https://almanac.httparchive.org/en/2021/.


Our mission is to combine the raw stats and trends of the HTTP Archive with the expertise of the web community. The Web Almanac is a comprehensive report on the state of the web, backed by real data and trusted web experts. It is comprised of 20+ chapters spanning aspects of page content, user experience, publishing, and distribution.


If you’re interested in contributing to next year’s report, check out our contributing guidelines.


How to use this kit

The Web Almanac UI Kit was designed to make it easier to contribute to new features and enhancements to our site. 


If you’re new to Figma, check out their youtube channel for some quick tutorial videos. They have a great playlist for beginners.


To start using this file

  • create a free figma account
  • click the duplicate button to create a copy of this file
  • use the layouts available as a starting point, or create your own design from scratch using the components and styles available within the file


Find any issues with this file? Open a ticket in github.
